sense.gloss: square on a grid, cell of a grid
square bearing block (at the top of a pillar)
square (e.g. of graph paper or Japanese manuscript paper)
tatami "box seat" for four people at sumo, kabuki, etc.
square bearing block (at the top of a pillar)
rectangular space between the inner and outer gates of a castle (where troops can gather)
alcohol (esp. sake) served in a small wooden box, alcohol (esp. sake) sold in a small wooden box
selling something by the boxful (in a wooden masu box)
square framing (in a house, temple, screen, etc.)
masu container for drinking or measuring sake

sdata.j: チェッカー↑盤↑↓ばん↓の↑黒↑↓くろ↓と↑白↑↓しろ↓の↑枡↑↓ます↓は↑交互↑↓こうご↓に↑並↑↓なら↓んでいる。
sdata.e: The black and white squares on a checker board are arranged alternately.

words.gloss: tatami "box seat" for four people at sumo, kabuki, etc.
